Mr Smith was named for a french pirate, but was known to his acquaintances as Casto, a contraction of his middle name. Several years ago Mr Smith lived in Crossville and practiced as an attorney here. He was admitted to the Bar in 1888. He practiced in several towns and moved from Crossville to Knoxville to become a member of one of the leading firms of that city. During the term of office of Gov. A A Taylor, he was appointed a special justice of the State supreme court during the illness of chief justice D L Lansden, in which capacity he acted for 18 months. He also served twice in the 5th Judicial circuit...
